website_summaries.verdict: Great SPD clipless pedals for general riding that does not sacrifice on comfort and performance.
pros: Pedals feature cleat mounts on both sides so riders do not have to struggle with clipping in
cons: Aerodynamics and speed suffer from blocky pedal design

customer_reviews.title: SH-56 Multi-release cleats are easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: As a new cyclist, I wanted to switch from running shoes and a "plain" pedal to a cleat system. After watching numerous YouTube videos and reviews, I ordered the Shimano SH-56 SPD cleat set and the Shimano PD-M520L Clipless Bike Pedals 9/16in. plus a pair of Shimano shoes that accept cleats. Local bike shop installed everything for $10. First time out was easy to clip in and out without any problems. Just be sure to set the pedals to the low force setting. A great system which adds a lot more power and enjoyment to cycling. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dog owner

customer_reviews.title: Great for a stationary bike
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and solid. These fit and work great with my Sunny Health stationary bike. Cleats included.
customer_reviews.author: dcc

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals
customer_reviews.text: For my new bike; I use these "mountain" pedals on all my bikes whether road, cross or off-road. They've been solid performers in all kinds of weather, and I like that my cleats slip into the pedals quickly on either top or bottom. Both the same. I prefer the SH56 Shimano cleats because they release in all directions -- safer in my book than the single release SH51's.
customer_reviews.author: Hexadoog

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pedals, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pedals. No reason to spend more unless you are a high level competitor. I upgraded from some older Shimano and very old coda spd pedals, and I’m glad I did. These are far easier to clip in to due to the minimalistic profile. The release is much tighter than I’m used to as mine were old and pretty worn in, but a quick adjustment to loosen the tension on these and I was in a comfort zone within a few minutes. Highly recommended, looking forward to many miles on these.
customer_reviews.author: ChazinPA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clip in and out
customer_reviews.text: Since these are my first set of clip-less pedals, I needed a pair that can be easy to get in and out. These pedals fit the bill and price wise, were definitely on target. I put these on my MTB and after some adjusting, had increased my efficiency tremendously. You should get these if learning to use clip-less for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Redding II

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pedals
customer_reviews.text: This design works out really well. I like the SPD shoes because of the ease of walking on my Trek 520 for touring/commuting. I have bee rebuilding my 1990 Cannondale Black Lightning, which is black and replace some 1990 vintage Look Carbon Pros. The Looks are great but with those cleats it is tough to walk in them and doing so in gravel really messes them up. These pedals work as well and the Looks but I have my SPD shoes and they are really much better off the bike. There are different levels of this design. This one weighs a bit more than the more expensive ones but work fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: David E

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend, worked great, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic clipless pedals. I had been procrastinating getting new pedals thinking they would really be expensive. I found these Amazon and Shimano is a great brand and a friend had just given me some new shoes. These came, they match my Giant bike, easy to install, my husband installed the clips on my new shoes and with no adjusting I was cycling and getting in and out of clips easily. No problem unclipping but also no problem with the tension for unclipping being too loose. Very impressed. Great Buy
customer_reviews.author: CurleyKai

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Performance
customer_reviews.text: Having ridden very briefly with clipless pedals only to switch back to flats, I recently have gone back to clipless; both sets being used on a rigid MTB ridden almost exclusively on the road. The PD-M520L's are providing solid, reliable performance for my style of riding and proving to be a very worthwhile alternative to my flats which by the way, are simply amazing in their own right; a pair of Shimano PD-MX80 Saint Pedals, the latter being used for those days where I'm needing to jump on and off my bike during a ride. You know, to mix in some burpees, short runs or other really fun (NOT!) stuff.
customer_reviews.author: ChipperTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great value and product. Love!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. I wanted two way pedals for my road bike that didn’t cost a fortune. Enter SPD’s. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: cozycactus

customer_reviews.title: ... these on my road bike and I am very happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my road bike and I am very happy with them. I've put about 300 miles on them and they perform very well. I already owned a pair of SPD shoes for my spin class and now I'm able to use my shoe on both spin and road bikes. They are a little harder to get into since the clips are smaller than the LOOK style pedals but once you're used to clipping in and out of them they are great. I also like the fact that they have a lot of float which prevents knee pain.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando C. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good pedals
customer_reviews.text: These are just as good as any other spd pedal out there. They may be a few grams heavier, so the gram counters aren't going to like them much. Easy to clip into, and to unclip. They are getting scratched for the clipping and un-clipping. I didn't buy them for looks, I bought them for function. They function just fine. They do what they are supposed to, and don't cause problems. These are rebuildable, but are so cheap to buy when you can catch them on sale, and last so long, it seems rediculous to think about rebuilding them. Wear them out and get another set. I use these on my 'cross/gravel bike
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my road bike and my Peloton
customer_reviews.text: These pedals work perfectly for my road bike and I bought a pair for my peloton now. No noise or squeaks, fast and easy to snap into, and easy to break out of. Took about five minutes to install them and have been using them for a couple of months now on the peloton. Definitely an enhancement because it allows me to use my road shoes as I wasn’t a fan of the clips or shoes they were offering. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RafCon

customer_reviews.title: Took absolutely FOREVER to arrive, but totally worth it. Easy to get in and out
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was atrocious but can I really complain for a set of clipless pedals for $35? Probably not. Once they arrived, they were a breeze to install and so easy to get in and out of. Like so easy that I can't figure out why people have so much trouble with clipless pedals. I've clipped in on steep hills from a dead stop, they stay in and are super easy to release right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: IpMan

customer_reviews.title: Installed on stationary
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded the pedals on my stationary bike from the pedals it came with, with the clips and flat, to these Shimano pedals and I am super happy. The old pedals had a small click and these are smooth as ever. The clips I had work fine, they were right and properly adjusted out of the box. Only down side is they cost about 1/6th of the bike I got for Covid at home workouts. Using these pedals and exercise bike setup with Peleton and its great.
customer_reviews.author: == true;

customer_reviews.title: Best Value in Clipless Pedals
customer_reviews.text: The Shimano M520 is probably the best value in clipless pedals. I have these on my 6KU single speed and they work just as good as the XTR M9000 pedals (~$150USD) that I have on my cross country mountain bike. The big difference between the two pedals are the weight and the cost. If cost is not your concern or you need something ultra light, get the XTRs. However, if you want a great pedal at a great price, these are the pedals for you.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyFighter

customer_reviews.title: Used on MTB and Gravel bikes
customer_reviews.text: Shimano clipless SPD are lightweight and durable. I put these on my MTB for about one year and they worked fine. Sometimes they would clip out over large bumps unintentionally so I then switched out and put these on my gravel bike and they work great. Shimano makes high quality stuff so as expected these require little maintenance and clipping out requires little effort and training.
customer_reviews.author: Neal and Mere

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pedal
customer_reviews.text: Love Love Love these pedals. Will easily last a decade or more of you treat them with respect. If you pedal strike the ground a lot while mt bike you might have a slightly shorter life but really, these are so solid and super effective. They don't clog and they aren't tool heavy. But honestly those gram counters are so silly. Is 100 grams hear or there really gonna make a difference when we all could stand to loose a few pounds ourselves? Excellent pedal, will buy again and again for all my mt bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan From Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Awesome spds. Price makes it even better
customer_reviews.text: Awesome spds. Price makes it even better. Really don't have a complaint about these at all. I'm using them with my Sidi MTB shoes on a road bike and they work perfectly. Nice +\- adjusters to make beginners to spds (like me) learn how to use them. Suggestion is to put it on the loosest setting until you learn to clip in and out and then adjust accordingly. Clipping out of it is really easy - just twist your ankle outward. Love these clipless pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Ava411

customer_reviews.title: bullet proof, have four pairs
customer_reviews.text: I can't think of any purchases I've made that have been as reliable as these. Seriously. My family has four pairs and they've all been great. Thousands of miles. I like these more than the 540s because they can be installed with a pedal wrench or an allen/hex. I think the 540s only allow for a 8mm hex. Maybe not the lightest, but light enough and don't care.
customer_reviews.author: P N

customer_reviews.title: Faster than expected delivery
customer_reviews.text: I live in US and it took only 6 days to deliver from the UK, much faster than expected. This is the first time I'm trying clipless pedals with cycling shoes. I use this for my Sunny Health & Fitness SF-B1002 Belt Drive Indoor Cycling Bike, and it works great. I used regular cycling shoes that were SPD 2 hole capable, and the cleats fit my shoes. I had to losen the tension, and the clips now snap more easily in. I highly recommend this for your indoor spin bike.
customer_reviews.author: GemsG

customer_reviews.title: Decent pedals for indoor spin bike
customer_reviews.text: First pair of pedals we had replaced within a month. There was a clicking issue from a bearing. I found others online had similar issues with this model. Thankfully, we were within the timeframe to replace. Second pair seems fine, and we've not had any issues. Easy install and a nice addition to the spin bike.
customer_reviews.author: BTS34

customer_reviews.title: Clip
customer_reviews.text: These are precisely what I was looking for. I was thing about going with a dual spd so I could use regular shoes as well. But between trail and road riding these are perfect. I’m glad I didn’t get the dual platform.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable Classic
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are willing to spend a lot more money for a little less weight, these pedals are the absolute, hands down, no contest best value for the money. I have had them on my commuter bike for years and, literally *thousands* of clip-ins and clip-outs later, they still perform to perfection. I just bought a new pair for a newly acquired mountain-bike.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using SPD pedals and cleats for maybe 8 years or so. My old pedals were single-sided entry, so I always had to flip the pedal over with my toe before clipping in. These new pedals are double-sided entry, and I never knew what I was missing. It's so nice to be able to just clip in without looking down and without having to maneuver the pedal into the right position. I've been using them for about two weeks, and I am extremely pleased with the quality, value, and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: JDCinKY

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: I got Into biking last year. Was using basic stock pedals with old sneakers. My friend told me about these pedals and said they would change my ride. Holy guacamole...HE WAS NOT LYING!! These pedals are well built and simple. Work well with the shoes I purchased as well. If you’re looking for a quality, affordable clipless pedal, definitely give these a try!
customer_reviews.author: Megan & Jaymes

customer_reviews.title: First time Clipless and bought for patella pain.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, fits great with my Nishiki Mountain bike. I went on Nishiki's and Shimano's web page prior to purchasing just to make sure I ordered all the right parts/ shoes. Installment doesn't take long once you know what you are doing/ looking at. I was a little hesitant at first that I would have trouble riding my bike, this being my first pair, but it really wasn't difficult at all. They help minimize some of my knee pain while riding also, I use these pedals and a neoprene brace for my knee and so far seems to be better on my knees.
customer_reviews.author: J18S

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying these!
customer_reviews.text: So far have really enjoyed these! I'm accustom to clipping in from spin class, but this is my first time going clipless on my road bike. LOVE IT! These are easy to clip in and out. I had no problems. Riding in them feels great. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Paulding

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pedals as a second pair for my road bike. The SPD-SL ones that I use for the summer have a wide, thick cleat, where these have the old style simple SL cleat. This makes it FAR easier to slide winter shoe covers over, which was what I wanted. Since cold winter riding here in North Carolina is just moderate pace base miles, any power loss compared to the other style cleat and pedal is nominal. Overall, a good value, good quality pedal for my use.
customer_reviews.author: NC 50-something guy

customer_reviews.title: Happy after 1,000 miles.
customer_reviews.text: I only have about 1,000 miles of use on those pedals and I'm satisfied so far. Easy to engage/disengage, adjustable if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: alferit

customer_reviews.title: Easy release
customer_reviews.text: NOT Great clipless pedals for the price.I’m sorry to have to change my review I bought these a little over a month ago and haven’t had much of a chance to ride lately so I only have about 150 miles on them, rode today and the left pedal is making a loud click on each revolution. The bearings must be giving out. Expected better from a Shimano component. Not happy that they lasted just past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amaze on custom cabinets

customer_reviews.title: Still very stiff!
customer_reviews.text: I adjusted these pedals to their lightest setting and still am having issues getting in and out of them. They are new, and possibly required a breaking in period but my previous Shimano pedals were not any problem at the beginning to engage and disengage
customer_reviews.author: Sutiikare

customer_reviews.title: Great multi use pedal
customer_reviews.text: I have a Kona Rove steel frame I am using for bike touring. I threw these pedals on it and so far so good. Lots of gravel and road riding this last year and the pedals have held up to the abuse. I’ve also thrown them on my full suspension MTB for a few rides and I’m happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Happy riding.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, I have used this model on both my road bike and my Tri Bike. Easy to install, adjust, and maintain. Would buy again. I do question why there is almost a $10.00 price difference in the three color options.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Peloton approved!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect pedal for my peloton! Easy to install (prepare yourself to encounter some gooey residue from pedal). I can finally wear my TIEM shoes and ride more comfortably. Easy to click into and out of! 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: kmsmit182

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very well made pedals for the money. They have an adjustment for clip-in and release pressure. I had to back off this adjustment quite a bit to make them easier to unclip from, still clip harder than my other pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Roadking

customer_reviews.title: Go fast, or get passed.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pedals for the price. My 8 year-old has no trouble using them. Very easy tension adjustment screw. The included cleats will need time to break in, but they are great. If you are pro, there may be better, but for intermediate riders these are the way.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: A great pedal for the money
customer_reviews.text: Slightly heavy feeling. The spring is very tight, so I adjusted the tension to the lowest setting possible. I have these pedals on two of my bikes and two of my wife's, so I am bit that concerned with weight and I know that the tension will eventually loosen up with use. A great pedal for the money. I am not sure that an extra $100 for more expensive pedals will give me an extra $100 of usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: robert c hastings

customer_reviews.title: Great for bike shoes with recessed SPD cleats.
customer_reviews.text: Love the double-sided design, which makes clicking in so much easier than my previous pedals. They also are a much better fit for easy click-in and release of bike shoes with recessed SPD cleats.
customer_reviews.author: SB-Rider

customer_reviews.title: These are the ones
customer_reviews.text: If youre going clipless, these are the ones to get. Theyre mountain bikes pedals, so youll use mtn bike clipless shoes, which are more comfortable and stylish than road shoes. These are very easy to clip in and out of, and tension is easily adjusted with a hex wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Initial impression: perfect for a beginner like me
customer_reviews.text: I easily installed these pedals and installed the cleats on my new Tommaso Montagna 100 shoes. I went out to my small back yard and began learning how to use them. I fell five times but three of them came when I put myself into a situation in which I’m likely to fall, to learn how to work through the panic. That still needs work. These pedals, though, work well for a clipless novice like me. I will (hopefully) update my review if I hit upon a snag.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Black

customer_reviews.title: A solid general purpose pedal.
customer_reviews.text: As stated, decent all around pedal. It's not super light. But good enough for mountain biking and a more casual road biker. Also it offers a measure of pedal float, so your heal can find its natural position.
customer_reviews.author: MechChef

customer_reviews.title: Locks you in tight, and easy to get out of
customer_reviews.text: I put them on my spin bike, and so far they are great. When you click in you are in. Seem to be really well made. I'll post another review later and let everyone know how there holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: These are a game changer for your spin bike! I swapped out my toe cage pedals for these and was able to push a lot harder and go faster. They were super easy to install and swap out!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany cobble

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: since becoming paralyzed, they keep my paralyzed side connected with the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Swap out for Peloton
customer_reviews.text: Switched out my delta pedals for these on my Peloton. Work great and very satisfied! REMEMBER, these when swamped out can void your warranty, so be mindful.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Van Loon

customer_reviews.title: Good pedal but Shipped from China...long delivery
customer_reviews.text: Pedal are fine. Work as expected. Seem to have a lot of play. More than my previous spd’s. Only reason for 3 stars because they come from China and take a long time to be delivered. That’s on me but it bears mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Works on a peloton
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to put on our peloton as we already had SPD shoes and didn’t want to buy new shoes to fit the LOOK system the Peloton comes with. They’re not as pretty as the peloton pedals but they work fine and came with a pair of cleats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, quick install, very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new-to-me Scott Solace road bike and needed new pedals, these are perfect. Easy to install and work great with my shoes. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: HappyVegas

customer_reviews.title: Dependable. Good performance. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my wife's bike in a matter of a few minutes, and she has no issues clipping in and out. For the price, the quality and dependability can't be beat. Performs well, as expected. There are both heavier and lighter pedals out there.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals!
customer_reviews.text: I have a hybrid bike with Shimano platform/SPD pedals, so I wanted SPD pedals for my new road bike so I didn't have to have more pairs of shoes, and these have been great for me. They adjust easily for greater or lesser resistance...I had them unclip at a bad time once but just increased the tension, and they've been great since...they unclip without difficulty but hold the shoe well, which is important as some of my cycling is in traffic and requires some on and off of the bike. Bonus: the white ones were on sale, and my bike is white, so they look great, too! Like the bike came with them even....
customer_reviews.author: Bekah

customer_reviews.title: pedals and clips!
customer_reviews.text: Both the pedals and SPD Clips were fairly easy as long as you have the proper tools. Be sure to play with the the tightness in both sides of the clips before you go for a long ride. I chose to completely loosen them first and tighten them up from there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They do the trick!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a racer, so these pedals are fantastic for me. I needed something quick and cheap to replace a set of over-worn SPD's and found these. They look good, easily installed, and are fairly free-moving. You have a little more spinning resistance than you might find in the $100's models, but for the MTB riding I do, it's not critical that I have something with zero resistance. I use these on two Mountain bikes, and my road bike (mainly because I don't want to buy another set of shoes.)
customer_reviews.author: B. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking pedals
customer_reviews.text: These are great for someone that wants to start using SPD pedals. It's a bit on heavy side but it does the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and use. Durable and haven't had any issues. Used for over 30 rides for my Sunny spin bike and they are in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: TARENCE P

customer_reviews.title: Great for Peloton
customer_reviews.text: A steal at the price. Easy to add to my Peloton bike. Much easier the the stock Peloton LOOK pedals to unclip.
customer_reviews.author: Middle GA Dad

customer_reviews.title: Taking my stationary bike to the next level
customer_reviews.text: I added these to my stationary bike and now I feel so cool clipping in, like I have my own little Peloton. It definitely makes the workout more intense (and fun).
customer_reviews.author: Robbinski

customer_reviews.title: Easily installed, work great
customer_reviews.text: I installed these on a spin bike so I could wear my bike shoes and they work great! Super durable and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for indoor training
customer_reviews.text: Had a set of these on my bike for a few years so I bought another set to use on my stationary so I could practice over the winter in the gear I'll use in the summer. They have been great!
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Really like these pedals, went from double planforms to these smaller profile, they have a smooth action no issues clipping in or out. Great for the price point feel solid.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck1000rr

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just switched over to clip pedals and these were great for the price. I bike often and these have held up!
customer_reviews.author: sschwe3

customer_reviews.title: Glad I switched
customer_reviews.text: I switched out my pedals and clips. It's easy to take my shoes to spin class or on my actual bike. I appreciate the ease of installation and being able to have one set of shoes. Clipping in and out is much easier.
customer_reviews.author: LM Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: They work, reliable, tough
customer_reviews.text: Don't mess with a classic. Works great to add extra stability to your ride. I use this on 2 mountain bikes and a road bike. They just work, keeping my feet secure in the clips. Had them on since 2014.
customer_reviews.author: max corbett

customer_reviews.title: A great entry level clipless pedal. (Rhyme not intended)
customer_reviews.text: These are my first clipless pedals. After several no speed falls, I've come to enjoy them. I would definitely recommend opening up the tension quite a bit at first until you get confident enough to find your sweet spot. They seem far more efficient then standard open petals, but they do require some quick thinking and pre planning when things get dicey or when coming to a stop. You're probably only forget once or twice that you have to pop your feet out, but after that you should be golden!
customer_reviews.author: Banacek

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed easy to use -- great for mountain biking
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pedal clips and I have to say I really like them a lot. Easy to clip into and get out of in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: The classic entry bike clips
customer_reviews.text: The classic entry bike clips, I have them on both of my road bikes. Easy to use, can clip on either side. A bit small and tedious if you want to just ride with normal shoes or sandals down the block but overall doable
customer_reviews.author: E. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Boughgt these for my wife to introduce her to clipless pedals, she LOVES them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals! Great quality at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great clips! Great quality at a great price. Perfect fit for my shimano spd clips. So much better than the old style pedals that i had on my road bike. A must have if you want to utilize more muscles in your legs throughout the entire pedal stroke.
customer_reviews.author: Tamera L. Bergeron

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Needed a second pair for my road bike. These are great and great price.
customer_reviews.author: pressm4n

customer_reviews.title: Good pedal
customer_reviews.text: This pedal provided everything I was looking for. Easy to install and shoes clip in pretty well, not perfect, but close enough that I’d give it 5 stars across the board.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Easy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought those for my joroto bike instead of the cages. Wonderful fit.
customer_reviews.author: artfulgiving

customer_reviews.title: First Clipless pedals
customer_reviews.text: This is my first clipless pedals. The installation was very simple, just make sure you put some grease on each and tighten it up with 15mm wrench. Will give more updates after testing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Simpson

customer_reviews.title: The Best I Ever had
customer_reviews.text: After disappointments with delicate Egg Beaters, I went back to these indestructible SPDs on my touring and mountain bikes. Heavier than some of the others but no disappointments otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Snead

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase and they do come with cleats
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Love these pedals. After adjusting 2-3 times to fit my style, haven't had any second thought. Great for beginner through advanced.
customer_reviews.author: hospitality1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome clipless pedals
customer_reviews.text: Works well as advertised. Easy to installed and it took me some time to figure out to adjust the tension. But overall, very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tran

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Clip In
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pedals. I use them on my Trek road bike. So much more easy to snap in than standard on-sided pedals. I have two road bikes and use them on both.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Tes

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Super easy install. These are my first set of clipless pedals and I picked it up within about 5 minutes. These pedals could not be easier to use and I loosened the tension all the way to be able to clip in easier. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Smith

customer_reviews.title: High quality, budget pedals
customer_reviews.text: Simple double sided pedals. Shimano continiess to make quality products.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: First pair of clipless, I like them but haven't had them long enough to comment on longevity. Not any real platform for your feet to rest on, which can be a little unnerving if you're used to wide flat pedals. I use with the SH-56 multi-release cleats, they clip in and out without even thinking of it and you can still pull hard with them without accidental release.

customer_reviews.title: Great for begger road biker.
customer_reviews.text: I love them. Great price. Great product. I new to sport by i can see myself continuing to use this pedal. Once out on a city trail and i had clipping in and out. I loosened the tension all the way then turned 1/4 turn. I will tighten them as i get more familiar with clipping.

customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly on my SUNY indoor spin bike. They were easy to install with a wrench and I feel much more secure by biking clipped in on the bike!

product_meta.title: SHIMANO SPD Pedal Clipless Pedals
product_meta.description: "Capable - wide enough gear ratio and good gear step optimized for from steep climb to fast decent. keep pedaling in efficient front driving gear with wider range cassette for riding up and down through trails. low gear option for wide tire trend (27.5 plus) and women and youth. efficient - smooth shifting of front and rear in rhythm in order to maintain speed and acceleration in change of terrain. less loss of pedaling power by rigid structure with easy and effortless shifting operation. confident - predictable; stable and durable brake with sleek style. reliable front shifting even when the rear suspension moves. improved stability and chain retention of drivetrain in rough terrain."
feature_bullets: Shimano pedaling dynamics - spd performs whether you’re on or off the bike; makes pedaling more efficient with a wide variety of shoe and pedal styles; and the recess cleat makes walking more comfortable
Innovative - by eliminating toe-clips and integrating the pedal and outsole into a single; unified power transfer system; shimano changed the industry
Incredible performance - spd not only boosting power to the pedal; but also the rider’s control over increasingly adventurous styles of riding
Better control - you can pedal with greater efficiency; stability and comfort with the spd system
Superior mud-shedding design - an open binding design allows mud and debris to be flushed out when the rider steps in
